title: Highland boy, 10, dies from gunshot wound
content:
SHREVEPORT, LA (KSLA) -
The 10-year-old boy shot in the head Friday evening inside a Highland home has died.
Detectives say 2 siblings and at least one parent were in the house in the 200 block of Prospect St. around 7:30 p.m. when the child was shot.
He was rushed to University Health. Hospital officials confirmed early Monday morning that the boy died of his injuries on Saturday. His name has not been released.
Information gathered from those inside the home at the time suggests the boy found the loaded weapon in the house and accidentally discharged it, striking himself in the head.
Police have said it was a small-caliber handgun, legally owned and registered to an occupant of the home.
No one else in the home was injured.
No charges have been filed in connection with the incident. Police say the investigation continues.
